title: Simulations help explain how genomes take form of 3-D chromosomes

title_detail.value: Simulations help explain how genomes take form of 3-D chromosomes

summary: Scientists trying to solve the ultimate puzzle -- the architecture of the human genome -- have snapped another piece into place. They have developed a model to explain one part of the mechanism, the folding of chromosomes during a cell's interphase. Their work offers the possibility of predicting the three-dimensional organization of entire genomes from limited one-dimensional data.
